definition: to hesitate to move forward/to balk/to jib
to shrink back (from sth)
to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks
variant of 巡[xun2]
(negative prefix)/not/no
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: And many of them balk when presented with commercial software.
sentences.chinese: 他们中许多在商业软件前逡巡不前。

sentences.english: The horse balked at the high fence.
sentences.chinese: 马在高栅栏前逡巡不前。

sentences.english: The balky horse refused the jump.
sentences.chinese: 马逡巡不前拒绝跳过去。

definition: to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance
hesitant to take action
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
(idiom) to hesitate/to remain undecided
to retreat/to shrink back
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
hesitant and not daring to move forward (idiom)
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
to collapse on the first encounter/to give way at once
to intercept/to waylay/to ambush
